title.rendered: CGB´s 25th Anniversary. Words From our Founder and General Manager

content.rendered:
CGB´s 25th ANNIVERSARY. WORDS FROM OUR FOUNDER AND GENERAL MANAGER


When we were celebrating our 20th anniversary I remember bringing out lots of anecdotes of how our school came to life “Against all Odds” … today on our 25th anniversary, I´d like to change the perspective towards what has changed in this past 25 years.

At that time I remember internet was still in its very early stages, so in order to have a good connection, we mounted a big parabolic antenna on top of what is today our dining room and rented a dedicated band connection to a satellite called SatMex5 so not only our school but our families were able to connect to the internet from their homes via their home line phones(we had 60 telephone lines dedicated only for this purpose) so you called to school from your home an the connection sounded something like eeeeooooaaaakkkkk… and you putted your phone over a special microphone that your computer had and then you had internet on your computer at home… at that time there was no Google no Facebook no Instagram … can you imagine …!!

When the school began I still was living in what today is the preschool art classroom, mom and dad still lived in what today is our library, and my mom, that´s in heaven, did most of the gardening … s I can tell you without a doubt that CGB is not only part of our family but really runs through our veins.

We began with only 39 kids and the implementation of the British National Curriculum, today we have a much more international focus (that sounds like the encrypted chat codes of our teenagers) with VESS, IPC, IMYC, IGCSE and the IBDP, and we have accreditations of CIS and NEASC and are part of the Round Square worldwide network and the LAHC School Network. But why do we have all this … well in order to try to deliver the best quality education for a multicultural International School like CGB is.

And I want to stop a moment to make a small reflection on what it means, and why is so nice to be in a multicultural environment, and this is basically because it promotes respect for the difference, teaches multiple perspectives, encourages critical thinking, embraces diversity and fosters acceptance and tolerance in a learning environment … were we might have different backgrounds and customs, but we can still be friends with respect and kindness … and this is what we need, to make our World a better World.

When I was your age, this used to be my home and I loved it, now its your 2nd home and I really hope you love it too …

Happy 25th Anniversary CGB…!!!

Andres Fernandez
